review_text:
This is a cozy basement apartment, with an upstairs entry / sitting area, located on the edge of Houghton near ski and forest trails, and within close range of the university. Amenities are set-up especially well for weekend travellers, but Alan is open to longer-term stays and very amenable to helping facilitate them, such as I experienced. With space for an automobile, the location can be used by airbnb stays that are more "drop-in" while touring around the area, but it is also completely possible to use it more as a temporary residence, as well as to get along without a car, so long as one can walk up and down the steeper topography of the Houghton area.
Probably you will find it fun to order some take-out food for some of the evenings, but the kitchen is fully equipped with a full fridge and freezer, eating ware, and the basics for simple cooking upon a plug-in induction stove. Fancy meals are not recommended, but why cook like that when away from home, anyway?
The decorations are "homey," "northwoods," and representative of local artists. The space is very large, with sufficient room for a couple people to stay in a fold-down bed in the living room space with separation from another two people possible to share the bedroom area. Bring slippers as it is a basement, but rugs keep the feet warm, too. Smile as you hear the cat running along the ceiling and the laughter of a few kids, and feel yourself welcomed to Houghton, it's family-friendly atmosphere, and the close surroundings of the forests.

Comfy place. Host was pretty responsive.

Granny's Place is a fun and unique place to stay on your visit to Keweenaw and Lake Superior. Jenn and Jason are friendly hosts who are willing to chat with you, if you chose, but also who give you space and privacy, if that is your preference. The apartment is a comfortable space to stay on a hobby farm with sheep, chickens, turkeys, and ducks who we had fun feeding a snack of corn provided by our hosts. Our visit occurred in late June 2022 when the weather was very mild and wildflowers were in bloom and abundant.
The apartment is attached to the back of the hosts' house with its own separate entrance in the side yard. We used it simply as a place to stay at night. It provides amenities similar to a hotel mini-suite with a bathroom with stand-up shower, comfortable bed in the sleeping area, and small "living room/kitchen" with a sofa, chair, and small TV connected to an internet type content provider. The kitchen area has a sink, mini-fridge, microwave and hot plate provided. This mini-kitchen is convenient for preparing simple meals or snacks, but would not be appropriate for baking or cooking a big meal.
Located about 8 miles north of Houghton on Canal Road, this sweet and rustic retreat is off the beaten path, a short distance from a small county/township owned beach on Lake Superior, and was a place that my wife and I really enjoyed on our four day vacation exploring the Keweenaw Peninsula.
We used Granny's Place as our base camp, while we explored the small towns and villages of the area, toured the Eagle Harbor lighthouse (a wonderfully scenic and historic place to visit), walked Michigan Tech's campus and visited its outstanding mineral museum, studied the history of copper mining in the area, and enjoyed the vistas of waterfalls, tall trees, and many miles of inspiring Lake Superior shoreline.
The area is a great place to visit for people who like love nature's beauty in an uncrowded setting while having the amenities of a college town near by. Having Jenn and Jason as our hosts at their rustic, comfortable, and unique place was the icing on the cake.
